facts: The April Uprising of 1876 was one of the most significant uprisings in Bulgarian history, aimed at liberating the country from Ottoman rule.
The suppression of the uprising was brutal, and many Bulgarians were killed or imprisoned, but it drew significant international attention to the Bulgarian cause.
The uprising was planned by the Bulgarian Revolutionary Central Committee and was triggered prematurely due to Ottoman suspicions.
hints: The year in which the uprising breaks out is 3 years after the death of Vasil Levski.
The uprising breaks out in a region known for its rebellious spirit and numerous revolutionary committees.
Immediately after the START OF THE UPRISING, Todor Kableshkov writes a letter informing the apostles in Panagyurishte about the events in Koprivshtitsa.
One of the famous organizers of the uprising is a revolutionary who led the 'flying squad'.
name: April Uprising

facts: The Kresna-Razlog Uprising of 1878 was an attempt to liberate the regions of Macedonia and Thrace from Ottoman control after the Congress of Berlin.
The uprising took place after the Treaty of Berlin, which divided the lands inhabited by Bulgarians and allocated them to other Balkan states.
Although the uprising failed to achieve its immediate objectives, it showed the desire for national liberation in the region.
hints: The uprising breaks out immediately after the Congress of Berlin.
The general command of 400 rebels, divided into detachments, who attack the Ottoman garrisons, is under which leader?
What is the goal of the 'Appeal by the Temporary Bulgarian Administration in Macedonia'?
Who sends a memorandum to the Great Powers, seeking the creation of a single vilayet?
introduction: The Kresna-Razlog Uprising was a major event in the national liberation movement of the Bulgarians in Macedonia and was part of the broader struggle for autonomy.
name: Kresna-Razlog Uprising
